articles.title: State health officials give update on coronavirus vaccine - WSPA 7News
The Coronavirus Is Airborne Indoors. But We’re Still Scrubbing Surfaces. - The New York Times
articles.description: Scientists who initially warned about contaminated surfaces now say that the virus spreads primarily through inhaled droplets, and that there is little to no evidence that deep cleaning mitigates the threat indoors.
articles.content: A range of respiratory ailments, including the common cold and influenza, are caused by germs that can spread from contaminated surfaces. So when the coronavirus outbreak emerged last winter in the C… [+1444 chars]

articles.title: A new study questions whether masks protect wearers. You need to wear them anyway. - The Japan Times
articles.description: Masks prevent people from transmitting the coronavirus to others, scientists now agree. But a new trial failed to document protection from the virus among the wearers.
articles.content: At that time, 2 percent of the Danish population was infected a rate lower than that in many places in the United States and Europe today. Social distancing and frequent hand-washing were common, but… [+1134 chars]

articles.title: Italian study suggesting COVID predates China outbreak sparks scepticism - Reuters
articles.description: An Italian study supporting the case that the novel coronavirus was circulating outside China earlier than thought has sparked doubts among some Western scientists who called for further tests.

articles.title: Here's why mouthwash is not going to save you from coronavirus - CNN
articles.description: It's trending on social media and generating excited media reports -- another study showing an ingredient found in mouthwash can kill the coronavirus. In this case, it's as fast as 30 seconds.
